segment.source: How to Create a Test Environment
segment.target: How to Create a Test Environment

segment.source: How to Create a Test Environment
segment.target: How to Create a Test Environment

segment.source: How to Create a Test Environment
segment.target: How to Create a Test Environment

segment.source: The following are some steps and instructions to help you create a test environment that you can use to test your MED-V workspace package locally before deploying it throughout your enterprise.
segment.target: The following are some steps and instructions to help you create a test environment that you can use to test your MED-V workspace package locally before deploying it throughout your enterprise.

segment.source: This section provides guidance about how to create a test environment, either manually or by using an electronic software distribution system.
segment.target: This section provides guidance about how to create a test environment, either manually or by using an electronic software distribution system.

segment.source: To create a test environment by using an ESD
segment.target: To create a test environment by using an ESD

segment.source: Use your company’s method of deploying software throughout the enterprise to deploy the following necessary components to a test computer.
segment.target: Use your company’s method of deploying software throughout the enterprise to deploy the following necessary components to a test computer.

segment.source: Install them in the following order:
segment.target: Install them in the following order:

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC – if not already installed.
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC – if not already installed.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC Additions and Updates– if not already installed.
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC Additions and Updates– if not already installed.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.

segment.source: MED-V Host Agent Installation File – installs the Host Agent (MED-VHostAgentSetup installation file).
segment.target: MED-V Host Agent Installation File – installs the Host Agent (MED-VHostAgentSetup installation file).

segment.source: For more information, see How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Installer, VHD, and Setup Executable – created in the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Installer, VHD, and Setup Executable – created in the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: For more information, see Create a MED-V Workspace Package.
segment.target: For more information, see Create a MED-V Workspace Package.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The VHD and Setup executable program must be in the same folder as the MED-V workspace installer.
segment.target: The VHD and Setup executable program must be in the same folder as the MED-V workspace installer.

segment.source: Then, install the MED-V workspace installer by running setup.exe.
segment.target: Then, install the MED-V workspace installer by running setup.exe.

segment.source: After all of the components are installed on the test computer, run the MED-V Host Agent to start first time setup.
segment.target: After all of the components are installed on the test computer, run the MED-V Host Agent to start first time setup.

segment.source: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you cannot physically run the MED-V Host Agent on the test computer, first time setup starts automatically the next time that the computer restarts.
segment.target: If you cannot physically run the MED-V Host Agent on the test computer, first time setup starts automatically the next time that the computer restarts.

segment.source: First time setup starts and can take ten minutes or more to finish.
segment.target: First time setup starts and can take ten minutes or more to finish.

segment.source: For information about testing your configuration settings when first time setup is running, see How to Verify First Time Setup Settings.
segment.target: For information about testing your configuration settings when first time setup is running, see How to Verify First Time Setup Settings.

segment.source: To create a test environment manually
segment.target: To create a test environment manually

segment.source: Install the MED-V Host Agent in a local test environment that includes MED-V prerequisites, such as Windows Virtual PC with additions and updates.
segment.target: Install the MED-V Host Agent in a local test environment that includes MED-V prerequisites, such as Windows Virtual PC with additions and updates.

segment.source: For information, see How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: For information, see How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: Copy the MED-V workspace files to your test environment.
segment.target: Copy the MED-V workspace files to your test environment.

segment.source: The MED-V workspace files are located in the destination folder that you specified in the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace files are located in the destination folder that you specified in the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The VHD and Setup executable program must be in the same folder on your test environment as the MED-V workspace installer.
segment.target: The VHD and Setup executable program must be in the same folder on your test environment as the MED-V workspace installer.

segment.source: Install the MED-V workspace by running setup.exe.
segment.target: Install the MED-V workspace by running setup.exe.

segment.source: Start first time setup by running the MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: Start first time setup by running the MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: First time setup starts and might take several minutes to complete, depending on the size of the VHD specified.
segment.target: First time setup starts and might take several minutes to complete, depending on the size of the VHD specified.

segment.source: You are now ready to test the different settings for configuration, application publishing, and URL redirection that you specified for your MED-V workspace.
segment.target: You are now ready to test the different settings for configuration, application publishing, and URL redirection that you specified for your MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: By default, MED-V overrides the screen lock policy in the guest.
segment.target: By default, MED-V overrides the screen lock policy in the guest.

segment.source: However, this does not pose a security problem because the host computer still honors the screen lock policy.
segment.target: However, this does not pose a security problem because the host computer still honors the screen lock policy.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Verify First Time Setup Settings

segment.target: How to Test Application Publishing
